document_data.name: Ice Hunters
document_data.mainbody: "'''Ice Hunters'''" or "'''Ancient Men of the North'''" were the names given to a sub-ethnicity of [[Ulutiun]]s who resided in the northwestern-most regions of [[Faer√ªn]].
document_data.Regions: The Ice Hunters lived in the [[Cold Run]], on the [[Ice Peak]], and on the [[Sea of Moving Ice]].
document_data.Description: Like their cousins from the [[Great Glacier]], The Ice Hunters were particularly clever and tended toward a lifestyle of [[lawful]]ness.

Society.Religion:
The Ice Hunters worshiped various nature spirits (beast totems) and were led by [[Ice Hunter shaman|shamans]]. These spirits included:
* [[Grandfather Walrus]],
* [[Great White Bear]],
* [[Clever Oomio|Clever Oomio the Gray Seal]], and
* [[Pindalpau-pau]] the Reindeer Mother.

In addition, they venerated the god [[Ulutiu]]. Powerful priests of Ulutiu were known as [[iceguardian]]s
Society.Language: Speakers of [[Uluik]],<ref name=D:SiT-p26>{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|26}} the Ice Hunters began using the [[Thorass alphabet]] by the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].

document_data.History: Scholars believed that the Ice Hunters immigrated to the far northwest from [[Kara-Tur]] over the polar icecap before the coming of either the [[Illuskan]]s or the [[Netherese]]. When the Illuskans arrived, many Ice Hunters were displaced from their native lands.
document_data.Notable Ice Hunters:
* [[Bleak Sky at Morning]], shaman of the village of [[Icewolf]].
* [[Orcaheart]], village champion of the tribe that dwelled upon the island of [[Oyaviggaton]].
